medical_history.chief_complaint: Adolescent rickets, vitamin D deficiency, and secondary hyperparathyroidism.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms developed at age 11 years with recurring valgus deformities. Initially asymptomatic until age 11. After treatment with vitamin D and calcium, features resembling familial hypocalciuric hypercalcemia (FHH) were unmasked.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Previous corrective osteotomies for valgus deformities; radial fracture at age 12 with prolonged healing. Dietary intake of calcium (500-700 mg/d) and vitamin D (100-200 IU/d) were low.
medical_history.family_history: Patient was the eldest of five children born to consanguineous Palestinian parents; two apparently healthy siblings were homozygous for CaSR Q459R with asymptomatic hypercalcemia and hypocalciuria. No calcium disorders or fractures reported in family.
medical_history.social_history: Migrated from Lebanon to Germany at age 9; not veiled, reported mainly indoor activities.
